page.title: 10Farming near Basingstoke
page.content: Home Farm is part of Hackwood Estate. It is 1600{acres}in size and is a {mixed farm.}The{main crops}are{spring and{winter barley, winter wheat, oats and{herbage seed. Break crops}are {millet, peas, kale, swedes and leys. 64{Murray-Grey Friesian cross beef cattle are kept and 2000{sheep}and {lambs - Welsh Mountain Black}and {Greyface.}The sheep were being{dipped in{disinfectant.}Most of the{stock}is kept in New Park in the woods. The farm's{machinery}is worth Â£250,000. It takes Â£370,000 to run the farm for one year. 8 people{work}on the farm. Some{hedges}had been taken out with some old trees left where the hedges had been growing. When we were walking out of the{barn to go back to{school}we saw a little black{kitten}eating a{mouse}or{rat.
